STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
May 24, 2024
Amy Eddinger
Mecosta/Osceola Youth Attention Center
126 MAPLE ST STE F, Suite F
BIG RAPIDS, MI, 49307-1878
RE: License#: CB540201289
Dear Amy Eddinger:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on May 15, 2024. The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Samantha Way, at (517) 243-9743.
Sincerely,
Melinda Gubbins, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
701 S. Elmwood, Ste. 11
Traverse City, MI 49684
(231) 342-3721
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• There was no technical assistance requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was reviewed. The chief administrator
indicated the agency did not have a CAP last year and there continues to be no
barriers to achieving compliance. The agency has maintained some experienced

staff for several years which makes the transition smoother when new staff are
hired. This is a small agency and staff work together to assist one another and
ensure compliance. The CA was a caseworker at one time and understands the
position and what is needed to be successful.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget, profit/loss statement and 2022 tax return.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Interviews were conducted with two staff members face-to-face at the agency.
Staff reported feeling supported by the agency as well as coworkers. Staff
expressed slight frustration regarding the on-call requirements and the challenges
it can bring due to being a small agency but felt they work well together to provide
coverage as well as balance.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of independent living services. All files were stored securely.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The agency does not certify foster homes, therefore, does not have an assigned
agency analyst.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
_________5/17/2024________________
Melinda Gubbins Date
Licensing Consultant
